content.description: Start at the right edge of the low angle moderately featured slab to the left of the main "Fine Line Area" where there are some old names and numbers scratched into the rock at the base. Follow small but generally positive diagonally running cracks past three bolts until you come to a notch in the roof above the third bolt. Clip the ring hanging over the lip of the roof then pull the roof and follow three more bolts through highly featured vertical terrain to a two bolt anchor. For full value and better climbing, stay on or just slightly left of the bolt line after the roof. In my opinion this climb is really a move or two of 5.10 at the roof surrounded by easier climbing. Note: Do not climb past the anchors, nothing but frightening choss.
content.protection: 7 bolts on route. 2 bolt anchor with rings to lower off. There is a 2 bolt ground anchor for those wishing to repeat the rope solo ascent.
content.location: Start at the orange slabs to the left of the large roofs left of the "Fine Line Area".

content.description: This is a great route to practice/teach top belaying and rappeling as the anchors are above a sizeable ledge that fits two people comfortably. It is still a bit dirty with some vegetation on route, but the rock is super solid.Start either directly under the first bolt or start as for sagaba and move up and left to the first bolt. Climb up the slab with intermittent smearing and good holds, then tackle a small overhang at the last bolt. Mantle onto the ledge and clip the anchors. Difficulty is a bit dependent on how directly over the bolt line you climb but is generally in the 5.7 area. A fun short climb for the grade if you're uninterested in the spooky hold-less top half of chutes and ladders.
Climb bolts to roof at 50 feet. Cruise roof on left side and finish to anchors.
Start left of Power surge at a crack.Follow low angle to roof, pull roof and follow two bolts with aluminum hangers.

climb initial overhang to slab/seam and roof. Clip first bolt on roof. Move up right clip second bolt on roof. Make a move down and attempt climbing over the over hang on slopey feet and hands. Try and find the OMG hold.
content.location: 25' right of Raptor. This climb is just right of a project.

content.description:
Climb ever steepening slab to left side of roof.   Several years ago a large chunk of rock fell off near the top. 

  Could now be called "Layin' on the Riverside". 

  Don't recommend climbing until hardware is replaced.
content.location: This climb starts on the ledge to the right of Raptor's 5th bolt.

content.description: Just left of Charming snakes. Major rock fall has basically destroyed this route.   Some bolts exists though.   This route description added for historical purposes

Start below and slightly left of first bolt. Move over slabby section. climb over small overhang on crimps and crack (crux). Move up to big over hang. Surmount overhang on far right. Follow remaining bolts to anchors.

The opening gully is the only PG-13 section, G rated after that. The top of the slab seems eternally dirty.Start up a chossy and dirty but easy gully, slinging a tree on your way to the high first bolt, then get established on the small foot ledge at the base of the slab. Climb much better rock up the slab, following the shallow right slanting corner to the anchors. Careful on lowering and cleaning due to the traversing nature of the route. Best to be cleaned by someone following through the draws.
content.location: Start under the large roof/overhang below a dirty gulley

content.description: Free climbing grade is a rough guess. Still very dirty, as it does not get cleaned off with rain but most of the rock is solid. It will need a lot of brushing, but it probably goes free. Follow flakes and crimps angling up and right through the overhang. This will likely have permadraws eventually, as it is a bear to clean.Having talked to someone who has tried it, he suggested 5.13 as the grade and recommends climbing it as 1 pitch from the ground.

climbs.name: Charming Snakes
climbs.fa: Eric Hörst, Bob Perna, Dixie Marich, Mike McGill, Lisa Hörst.

content.description: Start in chimney. Follow bolts up and over bulge to anchors.
content.location: Second route of this little area.

content.description:
Climb ever steepening slab to right side of roof.   Several years ago a large chunk of rock fell off near the top.

 Don't recommend climbing until hardware is replaced.
content.location: This climb starts on the ledge to the right of Raptor's 5th bolt.

content.description: The taller cliff section north of 'Cemetery Wall' proper.   There were second pitches on this wall, but suffered major rock fall.
